Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Modified Blumgart Mattress Suture in Pancreaticojejunostomy

Trial_Design.evidence: 224 patients scheduled for PD between June 2013 and May 2017 were randomised

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were those scheduled for PD, excluding those with severe comorbidities or requiring additional organ resection.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either the interrupted suture group or the modified Blumgart mattress suture group

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate whether the modified Blumgart mattress suture technique during pancreaticojejunostomy (PJ) reduces the incidence of clinically relevant postoperative pancreatic fistula (POPF)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of grade B/C POPF within 90 days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computerised with a permuted block size of 4, stratified by pancreatic texture.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 224 patients scheduled for PD between June 2013 and May 2017 were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 103 patients in the interrupted suture group and 107 in the modified Blumgart group were analysed by intention-to-treat.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Grade B/C POPF occurred in 7 patients (6.8%) in the interrupted group and 11 (10.3%) in the modified Blumgart group (P = 0.367).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences in postoperative complications were observed.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered with ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT01898780).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional sources.
